==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|手|t1=hand|受|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}.

There are actually three “hands” in this character, as {{zh-l|*爫}} also means “hand”. As does {{zh-l|*又}} graphically.

===Etymology===
Derived from {{och-l|受|id=2|to accept}}.
